guide.title: Gentoo Weekly Newsletter
guide.subtitle: 13 February 2006
guide.abstract: This is the Gentoo Weekly Newsletter for the week of 13 February 2006.

body.p:
Version 1.0 of eselect, the modular configuration framework, has been released. For developers, eselect simplifies the creation of -config and -update tools in the same way that the original ebuild simplified building software. For end users, eselect provides a more consistent interface and, as a side effect, implements part of GLEP 24 by making it easy to find available configuration tools.
Interested users may install app-admin/eselect, if they do not have it already. There is also a user guide and a developer guide available online.

Plusiaczek Linux (roughly translates to "fluffy" in English) has been released. Plusiaczek is an i686 LiveCD based on Gentoo and designed as a general purpose distro for Polish Linux users. It ships with KDE 3.5.1, packing only what the author considers its most useful applications, and a set of others like Wine, k3b, Koffice, Scribus, Frozen-bubble, PHP, MySQL, Postgres and XFCE. The 577MB ISO can be downloaded from sourceforge, is entirely in Polish, but can be "remastered" to use any other language. Author Piotr Maliński can be contacted by email or via the web site (of which an English version is available, too).

Florian Grässle of OpenUsability.org reports about a major revamp for Karim Ryde's Kuroo, the KDE Portage GUI project. It's undergone several changes that make it look much more KDEsque, and includes a number of new features, too.

The Gentoo community uses Bugzilla (bugs.gentoo.org) to record and track bugs, notifications, suggestions and other interactions with the development team. Between 05 February 2006 and 12 February 2006, activity on the site has resulted in:

ul.li: 894 new bugs during this period
476 bugs closed or resolved during this period
24 previously closed bugs were reopened this period

body.p: Of the 9272 currently open bugs: 77 are labeled 'blocker', 153 are labeled 'critical', and 522 are labeled 'major'.
